node.title: Mothers get bail, men remain in custody after group allegedly uses back roads to breach WA border
node.alt: A street sign in a remote part of the outback on the WA and NT border.
node.description: Two children are among the group that allegedly crossed into WA from the NT earlier this month in the midst of an COVID-19 outbreak there. The adult men are remanded in custody in Kalgoorlie.
node.content:
["The mothers of two children who were part of a group arrested after allegedly using back roads to cross into Western Australia from the Northern Territory have been granted bail.", "Police say a\u00a0group of seven was picked up in Kalgoorlie last night without G2G passes after travelling through the remote communities of Warburton, Cosmos Newberry, and Laverton.", "Police prosecutor Acting Sergeant Matthew Hallsworth told the Kalgoorlie Magistrate's Court the group travelled from the remote NT community of Docker River and \"deliberately avoided\" a police checkpoint on the border.", "The five adults have been charged with failing to comply with a direction under the Emergency Management Act.", "Elvis Stokes, from the Aboriginal Legal Service of WA, said the group had returned negative tests for COVID-19.", "\"My clients have all had their needle\u00a0and all have come back negative,\" Mr Stokes told the court.", "Mona Calma, 28, and Amanda Miranda Ward, 23, were granted bail late this afternoon to care for their children, aged three and seven, while quarantining at a Kalgoorlie hotel.", "Police did not oppose bail for the women\u00a0but they did for the three adult men.", "Dixon Ward, 62, Maurice Matthew Paddy, 39, and Kirsten Joseph, 23, were remanded in custody until December 6.", "\"It is serious \u2026 they've gone via Warburton, Cosmos Newberry, and Laverton,\" Acting Sergeant Hallsworth said.\u00a0", "The court heard they crossed the border on Saturday, November 20, so they would be required to quarantine until midnight on December 4.", "", "
The Warburton community lies 920km north-east of Kalgoorlie.(Supplied: Alison Woodman/ArtsEdge)
", "Part of the Northern Territory remains in lockdown due to COVID-19 clusters.", "The WA government downgraded the risk assessment for travellers from the Northern Territory to \"low risk\" from November 16.", "Travellers are still required to be double dose vaccinated, complete 14 days of self-quarantine, and present for COVID-19 testing.", "Mr Stokes said travel between border communities was commonplace.", "\"There's been no education of this out in the communities,\" he said.", "
Guilty pleas likely, lawyer says
", "Magistrate Genevieve Cleary said while the group had initially tested negative for COVID-19, Aboriginal communities would be \"seriously jeopardised\" if they were released on bail and again did not follow directions from authorities.", "\"This may be unfair because it's their traditional lands and they are people who have moved freely between those communities in the past,\" she said.", "Mr Stokes indicated the group would likely plead guilty.", "\"I have spoken to all of them,\" he said.", "\"They agree they breached it by coming to Kalgoorlie.\""]
